column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of CuIr2S4, CuIr2Se4, (Cu1−xZnx)Ir2S4, and Cu(Ir1−xCrx)2S4 were prepared following standard solid state routes in sealed, evacuated quartz ampoules.
#Text=Stoichiometric quantities of the metals and elemental sulfur or selenium were thoroughly mixed, pelletized, and sealed under vacuum.

#Text=The ampoules were slowly heated to various temperatures in 650–1100 °C range, as appropriate to targeted compositions, and held at these temperatures for several weeks with intermediate grinding and pressing.
#Text=All products were found to be single phase based on laboratory x-ray powder diffraction.

#Text=Standard characterization of DC susceptibility and four-terminal resistivity of the samples were carried out in Quantum Design PPMS-9 and MPMS-XL5, and found to be in excellent agreement with other studies18,33,35,40,49,60.
